page.title: 18HISTORY
page.content: {HISTORIC BUILDINGS}Hale Hall was constructed by Gilbert Ireland who had placed a stone tablet on the tower. It read{'built by Sir Gilbert Ireland {AODI 1674'.}The stone tablet has now been moved to Cleveland, Ohio. The foundations of the Hall were laid in 1617, and the Ireland crest forms the arms of the Hall. {HISTORIC CHURCHES Hale Church}is an ancient sandstone building standing just outside the village centre, on the site of a Chapel built in{1081. The graveyard is entered by two lych gates, the earliest graves date from the first half of the 18th century. the grave of the{Childe of Hale}dates from{1623,}and there is a tomb of all the families who lived at Hale Hall. Little is known about the very early Church as no records have survived.
